## vector

- `c()`: concatenate
  - flat stucture

- built-in functions: `sum(1:10)`, `mean(1:10)`, `sample(1:10)`, `rep()`

- `?typeof()`: integer, double, character, logical

### integer vector

#### recycling

- element-wise comparison

    ```{r}
    x <- c(1, 1, 2, 2)
    
    x + 2  # equivalent to...
    x + c(2, 2, 2, 2)
    ```

- logical operators: `==`, `!=`, `&`, `|`, `%in%`

#### recycling

```{r}
x <- c(1, 1, 2, 2)

x == c(2, 2, 2, 2)  # equivalent to...
x == 2
```

## Coercion

![Rules of Coercion](https://rstudio-education.github.io/hopr/images/hopr_0301.png){.half}

- if coercion failed, throw error

- manual coercion: `as.character()`, `as.logical()`, `as.numeric()`

```{r}
sum(c(T, T, T, F))

x <- c("male", "male", "female", "female", "female")
sum(x == "male")
```

## subsetting a vector

### index subsetting

```{r}
# z[<integer or integer_vector>]
z <- LETTERS
z[1]
z[1:5]
```

### Logical subsetting

```{r}
# z[<logical_vector>]
x <- c(1, 2, 3, 2)
x[c(FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)]

## Creating logical vectors
x[1] == 2  # return logical vector of length 1
x == 2     # return logical vector of length(x)
# Subset vector
x[x == 2]
```


## Modifying Values in vector

- assignment: `x[1] <- 10`


## Vectorization

```{r}
# weighted mean
prob <- c(1/6, 1/6, 1/6, 1/6, 1/6)
```


```{r}
vec1 <- c(1, 2, 3)
vec2 <- c(-1, -1, 1)
vec1 * vec2

inner_product <- sum(vec1 * vec2)
```

## if else 

```{r}
x <- 1

if (x > 0) {
    print('x is positive')
} else {
    print('x is not positive')
}
```
      
```{r}
x <- -1

if (x > 0) {
    print('x is positive')
} else if (x < 0) {
    print('x is negative')
} else {
    print('x is zero')
}
```  
Note: can use multiple `else if`.
      
- template

    ```r
    if (<condition 1>) {
        < do something >
    } else if ( < condition 2 > ) {
        < do something >
    } else {
        < do something >
    }
    ```
